title: Searching and Processing Plant Scientific names using the plantlist package
text: 批量查询植物科属，内置的数据主要来源于The Plant List网站 ( www.theplantlist.org/ )，其中被子植物采用APGIII分类系统，同时提供维管植物每个科的编号，可用于植物标本管理，方便编纂植物名录等。 直接生成科/属/种的列表, 以便导入Phylomatic, V.PhyloMaker等软件生成进化树 用中文名批量查询植物学名以及科属 查询学名的接受状态以及完整学名等 制作不同风格的中文植物名录Markdown源文件

title: Searching and Processing Plant Scientific names using the plantlist package
text: R软件中，类似的程序包还有： taxize (https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/taxize/index.html) Taxonstand (https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/Taxonstand/index.html)， 网站有： 植物分类查询 (http://tnrs.iplantcollaborative.org/instructions.html) NSII名录批量自动校对服务 (http://www.nsii.org.cn/2017/checklist.php) 中国生物物种名录 (http://www.sp2000.org.cn/) 。 相比之下，plantlist的主要特点在于： 使用校对过的内置数据，使用过程中不需要连网。 优化了查询单个物种名是否为接受名的算法，速度更快 查询结果所显示的信息更加简洁清晰 支持用中文名批量查询学名

title: Searching and Processing Plant Scientific names using the plantlist package
text: TPL() 用学名查询目、科、属以及科在分类系统中的编号 taxa.table() 基于TPL查询结果制作科、属、种列表，以便用Phylomatic软件建立进化树 status() 查询每个学名在The Plant List 1.1数据库中的接受状态（该数据库已经放在程序包中） CTPL() 查询中国记录植物的科、属、分布、海拔、IUCN等级等 count_taxa 统计CTPL查询结果出现的科、属、种等数量 make_checklist 根据CTPL的查询结果，制作三种风格的植物名录（按照系统发育顺序排列）

title: Searching and Processing Plant Scientific names using the plantlist package
text: acc_dat: Plant List 1.1 网站上的所有接受名 cnplants_dat: 《中国植物名录》及每个种的科、属、分布、海拔、中国IUCN等级以及特有性等数据 genera_dat: Plant List 1.1 网站上的所有属名列表，因源数据有一些错误，绝大部分已经修订。 orders_dat: Angiosperm Phylogeny Website (www.mobot.org/MOBOT/research/APweb/) 提供的各科所属的目。 syn_dat: Plant List 1.1 网站的异名数据库

title: Searching and Processing Plant Scientific names using the plantlist package
text: 由于plantlist最新版本的源代码保存在github (https://www.github.com/helixcn/plantlist)。 安装命令如下：
code: install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("helixcn/plantlist", build_vignettes = TRUE)

id: tpl根据拉丁名查询目科属及科的编号
what: TPL():根据拉丁名，查询目、科、属及科的编号
title: Searching and Processing Plant Scientific names using the plantlist package
text: TPL函数输入的数据必须是字符串向量。可以查询科、属、种的相应信息，但并不会提示学名是否为接受名。要查询学名是否为接受名，请用status()函数。
code: library(plantlist) TPL("Carex") # 薹草属 ##   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS     FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER  ORDER       GROUP ## 1       Carex          Carex Cyperaceae    APGIII_099 Poales Angiosperms TPL("Apple") # 苹果 ##   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER ORDER GROUP ## 1       Apple          Apple   <NA>          <NA>  <NA>  <NA> splist <- c("Ranunculus japonicus",              "Solanum nigrum",             "Punica sp.",              "Machilus",              "Today",              "####" )            ### 查询多个种 res <- TPL(splist)

id: taxa-table-基于tpl查询结果制作科属种列表
what: taxa.table() :基于TPL查询结果制作科、属、种列表
title: Searching and Processing Plant Scientific names using the plantlist package
text: 查询结果多用于Phylomatic或V.PhyloMaker等软件构建进化树。示例代码如下：
code: library(plantlist) sp <- c( "Ranunculus japonicus",           "Anemone udensis",          "Ranunculus repens",          "Ranunculus chinensis",          "Solanum nigrum",          "Punica sp." ) res <- TPL(sp) taxa.table(res) ## [1] "Ranunculaceae/Ranunculus/Ranunculus_japonicus" ## [2] "Ranunculaceae/Ranunculus/Ranunculus_repens"    ## [3] "Ranunculaceae/Ranunculus/Ranunculus_chinensis" ## [4] "Ranunculaceae/Anemone/Anemone_udensis"         ## [5] "Solanaceae/Solanum/Solanum_nigrum"             ## [6] "Lythraceae/Punica/Punica_sp."

id: status-查询每个学名在the-plant-list-1-1-本程序包内置数据-的接受状态
what: status() :查询每个学名在The Plant List 1.1 (本程序包内置数据) 的接受状态
title: Searching and Processing Plant Scientific names using the plantlist package
text: 函数参数: status(species =NA, exact =TRUE, spell_error_max =NULL) status函数可以查询变种var.、亚种 subsp.以及变型f.是否接受等信息 species为输入的字符串向量 exact表示是否进行精确匹配，如果选择FALSE，则所有能用grep正则表达式匹配的结果都会显示。一般用精确匹配即可 spell_error_max 为所允许的最大的错误拼写的字母数量 status函数对输入的物种名大小写不敏感，物种名的前后以及中间允许有多个空格，species可以包括或者不包括命名人（变型f.之前的命名人除外） 示例： 重要提示： 由于表示变型的 f. 有时也用于命名人中，因此，用status函数在查询变型时， 请勿为种添加命名人，但是变型的命名人可以提供或者不提供，具体为:
code: library(plantlist)  #### 查询一个名称 status("Myrica rubra") ## [1] "1 name(s) to process." ##   SCIENTIFIC_NAME                  AUTHOR   STATUS     FAMILY ACCEPTED_SPECIES ## 1    Myrica rubra (Lour.) Siebold & Zucc. Accepted Myricaceae     Myrica rubra ##           ACCEPTED_AUTHOR ## 1 (Lour.) Siebold & Zucc. #### 查询多个名称 status(c("Myrica rubra",           "Adinandra millettii",          "Machilus thunbergii",          "Ranunculus japonicus",          "Cyclobalanopsis neglecta")) ## [1] "5 name(s) to process." ##            SCIENTIFIC_NAME                  AUTHOR   STATUS        FAMILY ## 1             Myrica rubra (Lour.) Siebold & Zucc. Accepted    Myricaceae ## 2      Adinandra millettii                    <NA>     <NA>          <NA> ## 3      Machilus thunbergii         Siebold & Zucc. Accepted     Lauraceae ## 4     Ranunculus japonicus                  Thunb. Accepted Ranunculaceae ## 5 Cyclobalanopsis neglecta                Schottky  Synonym      Fagaceae ##       ACCEPTED_SPECIES         ACCEPTED_AUTHOR ## 1         Myrica rubra (Lour.) Siebold & Zucc. ## 2                 <NA>                    <NA> ## 3  Machilus thunbergii         Siebold & Zucc. ## 4 Ranunculus japonicus                  Thunb. ## 5 Quercus myrsinifolia                   Blume "Hypoxis hirsuta (L.)Coville f. vollosissima Fernald"#  （不能处理） "Hypoxis hirsuta f. vollosissima Fernald"#（能处理） "Hypoxis hirsuta f. vollosissima"#（能处理）

id: ctpl-用中文名查询科属分布海拔iucn等级数据
what: CTPL() :用中文名查询科、属、分布、海拔、IUCN等级数据
title: Searching and Processing Plant Scientific names using the plantlist package
text: 调用方式： CTPL(taxa = NULL) 其中，taxa是植物的中文名向量， print_as_list 只是打印方式的选项，如果为TRUE， 则用列表的方式打印。 注意： 由于涉及中文输入和输出，需要在Rstudio中操作 本函数返回值为data.frame, print_as_list参数并不改变返回值的数据类型

id: count_taxa-统计ctpl结果的科属种数量
what: count_taxa() :统计CTPL结果的科、属、种数量
title: Searching and Processing Plant Scientific names using the plantlist package
text: 调用方式： count_taxa(checklist_dat) checklist_dat 为CTPL()函数返回的结果，CTPL结果中没有信息的行，将会被忽略。
code: library(plantlist) res_CTPL <- CTPL(c("桃儿七",                     "连香树",                     "水青树",                     "绿樟",                     "网脉实蕨",                     "Magnolia coco",                     "Punica")) count_taxa(res_CTPL) ## Warning in count_taxa(res_CTPL): Taxa: '绿樟, Punica' do(es) not have full scientific name, ignored ## $NO_OF_FAMILIES ## [1] 5 ##  ## $NO_OF_GENERA ## [1] 5 ##  ## $NO_OF_SPECIES ## [1] 5 ##  ## $NO_OF_FAMILIES_BY_GROUP ##                    group no_of_families ## 1 2 Ferns and lycophytes              1 ## 2          4 Angiosperms              4 ##  ## $NO_OF_GENERA_BY_GROUP ##                    group no_of_genera ## 1 2 Ferns and lycophytes            1 ## 2          4 Angiosperms            4 ##  ## $NO_OF_SPECIES_BY_GROUP ##                    group no_of_species ## 1 2 Ferns and lycophytes             1 ## 2          4 Angiosperms             4 ##  ## $NO_OF_GENERA_BY_FAMILY ##              family no_of_genera ## 1     Berberidaceae            1 ## 2 Cercidiphyllaceae            1 ## 3   Dryopteridaceae            1 ## 4      Magnoliaceae            1 ## 5  Trochodendraceae            1 ##  ## $NO_OF_SPECIES_BY_FAMILY ##              family no_of_species ## 1     Berberidaceae             1 ## 2 Cercidiphyllaceae             1 ## 3   Dryopteridaceae             1 ## 4      Magnoliaceae             1 ## 5  Trochodendraceae             1 ##  ## $NO_OF_SPECIES_BY_GENUS ##             genus no_of_species ## 1        Bolbitis             1 ## 2  Cercidiphyllum             1 ## 3        Magnolia             1 ## 4 Sinopodophyllum             1 ## 5    Tetracentron             1

id: make_checklist-制作markdown格式的植物名录-按照系统发育顺序排列
what: make_checklist() :制作markdown格式的植物名录 （按照系统发育顺序排列）
title: Searching and Processing Plant Scientific names using the plantlist package
text: 调用： 参数： checklist_dat = NULL: 为CTPL函数返回的结果 outfile: 为输出的markdown文件的名称 theme: 有三种风格可选，其中 complex: 输出的资料最详实，包括IUCN等级、海拔、省级分布等 simple : 包括物种名和引证的标本 minimal: 只显示物种的中文名和完整学名 关于分类单元的排列顺序：在大类群上按照苔藓、蕨类、裸子植物、被子植物的顺序；每个类群下，按照科的顺序号；科以下，属按照字母排列；属下各种按照分类单元的拉丁名排列。如有提供标本引证，则在CTPL返回的数据框上添加名为SPECIMENS的列即可。
code: make_checklist(checklist_dat = NULL,                  outfile = "output_make_checklist.md",                  theme = c("complex", "simple", "minimal")) library(plantlist) res_CTPL <- CTPL(c("桃儿七",                     "连香树",                     "水青树",                     "绿樟",                     "网脉实蕨",                     "Magnolia coco",                     "Punica")) make_checklist(res_CTPL)

title: Searching and Processing Plant Scientific names using the plantlist package
text: 如果您使用了plantlist程序包，请通过以下方式引用（请根据版本和日期做相应修改）： Jinlong Zhang, Bing Liu, Su Liu, Zhenhao Feng Kaiwen Jiang (year). plantlist: Looking Status Plant Scientific Names based Plant List Database, Searching Chinese Names Making checklists plants R package version (X.X.X) https://github.com/helixcn/plantlist/

title: Searching and Processing Plant Scientific names using the plantlist package
text: 编写本程序包最早是2014年1月在中国科学院昆明植物研究所的《生态和进化中的现代统计：基于R语言的应用》（ http://blog.sciencenet.cn/blog-255662-793234.html ）课程时开始的。特别感谢杨雪飞老师的邀请以及多位老师同学共同讨论。 本程序包苔藓植物各科属的中文名由中国科学院植物研究所刘冰博士提供。 Plantlist 1.1 数据库来源于汪远分享的数据。 感谢高芳銮、李嵘、张健、朱慧玲、刘冰、胡晓丽、冯嘉恩、黄世芳、俞筱押、胡海花、李家湘、刘水银、鲍志贵、张美霞、葛斌杰、孔德良、刘振稳、龙文兴、金建军、夏尚文、李霞、陶旺兰、李秋萍、易逸瑜、张璋、骆争荣、彭舜磊、郭文永、贾蕙君等各位老师同学提出宝贵意见和建议。

title: Searching and Processing Plant Scientific names using the plantlist package
text: 数据来源 https://github.com/helixcn/plantlist_data 。 多识团队. (2016至今). 多识植物百科. http://duocet.ibiodiversity.net/. 刘冰, 叶建飞, 刘夙, 汪远, 杨永, 赖阳均, 曾刚，林秦文. (2015). 中国被子植物科属概览: 依据 APG III 系统. 生物多样性, 23(2), 225-231. 环境保护部, 中国科学院. (2013) 《中国生物多样性红色名录——高等植物卷 》 电子版来源： www.mep.gov.cn/gkml/hbb/bgg/201309/W020130917614244055331.pdf Christenhusz, M., Zhang, X. C., Schneider, H. (2011a). linear sequence extant families genera lycophytes ferns. Phytotaxa. 19:7-54 Christenhusz, M., Reveal, J., Farjon, ., Gardner, M. F., Mill, R. R., Chase, M. W. (2011b). new classification linear sequence extant gymnosperms. Phytotaxa. 19:55-70

what: Welcome to the Homepage of plantlist
title:
Looking Up the Status of Plant Scientific Names based on The
        Plant List Database, Searching the Chinese Names and Making checklists of plants
text: plantlist R package checking status scientific name higher plants based Plant List Version 1.1 (http://www.theplantlist.org/). also functions Searching Chinese Names Making checklist plants.

previous_headings: Welcome to the Homepage of plantlist
title:
Looking Up the Status of Plant Scientific Names based on The
        Plant List Database, Searching the Chinese Names and Making checklists of plants
text: haven’t devtools installed, please install typing R console.
code: library(devtools) install_github("helixcn/plantlist", build_vignettes = TRUE) install.packages("devtools")

previous_headings: Welcome to the Homepage of plantlist
title:
Looking Up the Status of Plant Scientific Names based on The
        Plant List Database, Searching the Chinese Names and Making checklists of plants
text: information, please refer manual function. Please feel free send email package maintainer Jinlong Zhang question comments package.
code: library(plantlist)  ### Check the status of a scientific name (with or without authorship)  status("Hypoxis filifolia")  ### Subspecies (with or without authorship)  status("Hypoxis kilimanjarica subsp. kilimanjarica")  ### Variaty (with or without authorship)  status("Hypoxis erecta var. aestivalis")  ### Form (with or without authorship)  status("Hypoxis hirsuta f. villosissima")  ### Important Warning: Since 'f.' is also used in the authorship, ### please do not provide the author name for the species when ### it is a form. Eg. ### "Hypoxis hirsuta (L.) Coville f. vollosissima Fernald". ### The function parse_taxa() inside the status() ### function will not be able to parse the name correctly. ### Therefore a form should always be provided as: ### "Hypoxis hirsuta f. vollosissima Fernald" ### or "Hypoxis hirsuta f. vollosissima".  ### Check the family/Order/family number for vascular plants TPL("Hypoxis") TPL("Hypoxis hirsuta")  ### Create a Family/Genus/Species Table for Phylomatic Software  sp <- c( "Ranunculus japonicus", "Anemone udensis",          "Ranunculus repens", "Ranunculus chinensis",          "Solanum nigrum", "Punica sp." ) res <- TPL(sp) taxa.table(res)

title:
Get the number of taxa under each taxonomic level for a dataframe generated
by the function CTPL — count_taxa
text: NO_OF_FAMILIES Number families data.frame NO_OF_GENERA Number genera data.frame NO_OF_SPECIES Number species data.frame NO_OF_FAMILIES_BY_GROUP Number families group higher plants, namely, Moss, Ferns Lycophytes, Gymnosperms, Angiosperms NO_OF_GENERA_BY_GROUP Number genera group, namely, Moss, Ferns lycophytes, Gymnosperms, Angiosperms NO_OF_SPECIES_BY_GROUP Number species group, namely, Moss, Ferns lycophytes, Gymnosperms, Angiosperms NO_OF_GENERA_BY_FAMILY name self-explanatory NO_OF_SPECIES_BY_FAMILY name self-explanatory NO_OF_SPECIES_BY_GENUS name self-explanatory

title: Parsing scientific names — parse_taxa
text: Parse scientific name different parts, namely: (1)genus, (2)species, (2)author, (3)infra-specific rank, .e. var., f., subsp., (4)infra-specific epithet, (5)author infra-specific rank

title: Parsing scientific names — parse_taxa
code: parse_taxa(taxa)

title: Parsing scientific names — parse_taxa
text: taxa character string, usually scientific name plant species

title: Parsing scientific names — parse_taxa
text: data.frame containing following columns: TAXON_PARSED input taxa name GENUS_PARSED genus: letters first white space SPECIES_PARSED specific epithet: letters first white space second white spaccce AUTHOR_OF_SPECIES_PARSED Author taxa, var./f./subsp. fouund , AUTHOR_OF_SPECIES_PARSED include letters (including whitespace) second gap onwards INFRASPECIFIC_RANK_PARSED either f., var. subsp., values detected taxa name. neighther f., var. subsp. detected, field left empty INFRASPECIFIC_EPITHET_PARSED either f., var. subsp. detected, letters "INFRASPECIFIC_RANK_PARSED" white space extracted INFRASPECIFIC_EPITHET_PARSED. neighther f., var. subsp. detected, field left empty AUTHOR_OF_INFRASPECIFIC_RANK_PARSED letters INFRASPECIFIC_EPITHET_PARSED treated AUTHOR_OF_INFRASPECIFIC_RANK_PARSED. neighther f., var. subsp. detected, field left empty

title: Parsing scientific names — parse_taxa
text: details explained value section

title: Parsing scientific names — parse_taxa
text: Jinlong Zhang

title: Parsing scientific names — parse_taxa
code: parse_taxa("Epirixanthes elongata Blume") #>                  TAXON_PARSED GENUS_PARSED SPECIES_PARSED #> 1 Epirixanthes elongata Blume Epirixanthes       elongata #>   AUTHOR_OF_SPECIES_PARSED INFRASPECIFIC_RANK_PARSED #> 1                    Blume                           #>   INFRASPECIFIC_EPITHET_PARSED AUTHOR_OF_INFRASPECIFIC_RANK_PARSED #> 1                                                                  parse_taxa("Epirixanthes elongata") #>            TAXON_PARSED GENUS_PARSED SPECIES_PARSED AUTHOR_OF_SPECIES_PARSED #> 1 Epirixanthes elongata Epirixanthes       elongata                          #>   INFRASPECIFIC_RANK_PARSED INFRASPECIFIC_EPITHET_PARSED #> 1                                                        #>   AUTHOR_OF_INFRASPECIFIC_RANK_PARSED #> 1

Looking Up the Status of Plant Scientific Names based on The Plant List
Database — plantlist-package

Looking Up the Status of Plant Scientific Names based on The Plant List

text: Looking status scientific names based Plant List Database search Families genus.

title:
Looking Up the Status of Plant Scientific Names based on The Plant List
Database — plantlist-package
text: Jinlong Zhang Maintainer: Jinlong Zhang <jinlongzhang01@gmail.com>

title:
Looking Up the Status of Plant Scientific Names based on The Plant List
Database — plantlist-package
code: TPL("Carex") #>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS     FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER  ORDER       GROUP #> 1       Carex          Carex Cyperaceae    APGIII_099 Poales Angiosperms TPL("Cherry") #>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER ORDER GROUP #> 1      Cherry         Cherry   <NA>          <NA>  <NA>  <NA> splist <- c("Ranunculus japonicus", "Hepatica henryi",             "Heracleum acuminatum", "Solanum nigrum",             "Punica sp.", "Machilus", "Today", "####" ) res <- TPL(splist) taxa.table(res) #> [1] "Ranunculaceae/Ranunculus/Ranunculus_japonicus" #> [2] "Ranunculaceae/Hepatica/Hepatica_henryi"        #> [3] "Apiaceae/Heracleum/Heracleum_acuminatum"       #> [4] "Solanaceae/Solanum/Solanum_nigrum"             #> [5] "Lythraceae/Punica/Punica_sp."                  #> [6] "Lauraceae/Machilus/Machilus"                   #> [7] "NA/Today/Today"                                #> [8] "NA/####/####"

what: Looking for the taxonomic status of species — status
title: Looking for the taxonomic status of species — status
text: Looking taxonomic status scientific name plant based database Plant List Website.

title: Looking for the taxonomic status of species — status
code: status(species = NA, exact = TRUE, spell_error_max = NULL, detail = FALSE)

title: Looking for the taxonomic status of species — status
text: species vector character strings representing scientific names species exact Logical, Wheter exactly matching search applied. spell_error_max Integer, represents number spelling errors. effective exact = FALSE. detail Logical, implicate whether detailed version results displayed, including ID names searched.

title: Looking for the taxonomic status of species — status
text: function reture data frame containing following columns SCIENTIFIC_NAME scientifc name matched AUTHOR authorship SCIENTIFIC_NAME STATUS status matched scientific name FAMILY family provided plantlist website ACCEPTED_ID accepted ID matched scientific name ACCEPTED_SPECIES accepted species ACCEPTED_AUTHOR authorship accepted species

title: Looking for the taxonomic status of species — status
text: scientific names formatted processed, including: first letter scientific name changed upper case rest lower case; multiple whites paces replaced one, white space beginning end removed. scientific name parsed GENUS, SPECIES, AUTHOR_OF_SPECIES, INFRASPECIFIC_RANK, INFRASPECIFIC_EPITHET, AUTHOR_OF_INFRASPECIFIC_RANK, respectively. However, GENUS, SPECIES, INFRASPECIFIC_RANK, INFRASPECIFIC_EPITHET used searching embedded TPL database. Please note authorship used searching, therefore scientific name different authorship result multiple entries. Since 'f.' also used authorship,please provide author name species form.Eg. name "Hypoxishirsuta (L.) Coville f. vollosissima Fernald". provided "Hypoxis hirsuta f. vollosissima Fernald" "Hypoxis hirsuta f. vollosissima". exact = TRUE, function show species perfectly matching "keywords". exact = FALSE, function use general expression(function grep()) return species containting "keywords". function also allows Approximate String Matching (Fuzzy Matching) using agrep(), exact = FALSE spell_error_max > 0. much slower.

title: Looking for the taxonomic status of species — status
text: Plantlist Website http://www.theplantlist.org/ embedded database available http://pan.baidu.com/s/1hqHrW9I

title: Looking for the taxonomic status of species — status
text: Jinlong Zhang  jinlongzhang01@gmail.com

K.Rosenthal  Synonym Daphniphyllaceae #> 4    Loropetalum chinense             (R. Br.) Oliv. Accepted   Hamamelidaceae #> 5 Rhododendron latoucheae                    Franch. Accepted        Ericaceae #> 6     Rhododendron ovatum (Lindl.) Planch. ex Maxim. Accepted        Ericaceae #> 7      Vaccinium carlesii                       Dunn Accepted        Ericaceae #> 8          Schima superba           Gardner & Champ. Accepted tro-50060696 #> 224484     Rhododendron ovatum (Lindl.) Planch. ex Maxim. title: Making a Taxa Table based on the result of function TPL for Phylomatic — taxa.table
text: Webb, C. O. M. J. Donoghue (2005). Phylomatic: tree assembly applied phylogenetics. Molecular Ecology Notes 5(1): 181-183.

title: Making a Taxa Table based on the result of function TPL for Phylomatic — taxa.table
text: Jinlong Zhang  jinlongzhang01@gmail.com

title: Making a Taxa Table based on the result of function TPL for Phylomatic — taxa.table
code: sp <- c( "Ranunculus japonicus", "Anemone udensis",           "Ranunculus repens", "Ranunculus chinensis",           "Solanum nigrum", "Punica sp." )  res <- TPL(sp) taxa.table(res) #> [1] "Ranunculaceae/Ranunculus/Ranunculus_japonicus" #> [2] "Ranunculaceae/Ranunculus/Ranunculus_repens"    #> [3] "Ranunculaceae/Ranunculus/Ranunculus_chinensis" #> [4] "Ranunculaceae/Anemone/Anemone_udensis"         #> [5] "Solanaceae/Solanum/Solanum_nigrum"             #> [6] "Lythraceae/Punica/Punica_sp."

title: Looking up Family, Family Number and Order in Modern Classification Systems. — TPL
text: Please also pay attention following family names: Palmae= Arecaceae Gramineae= Poaceae Leguminosae= Fabaceae Guttiferae= Clusiaceae Cruciferae= Brassicaceae Labiatae= Lamiaceae Compositae= Asteraceae Umbelliferae= Apiaceae small proportion genus divided several genera, even placed different families, lead multiple entries one enquiry. Pay attention issues. Users need check acceptance based experiences knowledge. : Acanthocladium, Acanthodium, Acetosella, Acosta, Adelia, Agropogon, Alliaria, Amblytropis, Amelasorbus, Ammocalamagrostis, Anacampseros, title: Looking up Family, Family Number and Order in Modern Classification Systems. — TPL
text: Jinlong Zhang  jinlongzhang01@gmail.com

title: Looking up Family, Family Number and Order in Modern Classification Systems. — TPL
code: TPL("Carex") #>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS     FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER  ORDER       GROUP #> 1       Carex          Carex Cyperaceae    APGIII_099 Poales Angiosperms TPL("Apple") #>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER ORDER GROUP #> 1       Apple          Apple   <NA>          <NA>  <NA>  <NA> splist <- c( "Ranunculus japonicus",               "Solanum nigrum",               "Punica sp.",               "Machilus", "Today", "####" )  res <- TPL(splist) taxa.table(res) #> [1] "Ranunculaceae/Ranunculus/Ranunculus_japonicus" #> [2] "Solanaceae/Solanum/Solanum_nigrum"             #> [3] "Lythraceae/Punica/Punica_sp."                  #> [4] "Lauraceae/Machilus/Machilus"                   #> [5] "NA/Today/Today"                                #> [6] "NA/####/####"                                   TPL("Arecaceae") #>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS    FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER    ORDER       GROUP #> 1   Arecaceae      Arecaceae Arecaceae    APGIII_076 Arecales Angiosperms TPL("Palmae") #>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS    FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER    ORDER       GROUP #> 1      Palmae         Palmae Arecaceae    APGIII_076 Arecales Angiosperms  TPL("Poaceae") #>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS  FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER  ORDER       GROUP #> 1     Poaceae        Poaceae Poaceae    APGIII_106 Poales Angiosperms TPL("Gramineae") #>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS  FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER  ORDER       GROUP #> 1   Gramineae      Gramineae Poaceae    APGIII_106 Poales Angiosperms  TPL("Fabaceae") #>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS   FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER   ORDER       GROUP #> 1    Fabaceae       Fabaceae Fabaceae    APGIII_144 Fabales Angiosperms TPL("Leguminosae") #>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS   FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER   ORDER       GROUP #> 1 Leguminosae    Leguminosae Fabaceae    APGIII_144 Fabales Angiosperms  TPL("Clusiaceae") #>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS     FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER        ORDER       GROUP #> 1  Clusiaceae     Clusiaceae Clusiaceae    APGIII_211 Malpighiales Angiosperms TPL("Guttiferae") #>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS     FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER        ORDER       GROUP #> 1  Guttiferae     Guttiferae Clusiaceae    APGIII_211 Malpighiales Angiosperms  TPL("Brassicaceae") #>    YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS       FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER       ORDER #> 1 Brassicaceae   Brassicaceae Brassicaceae    APGIII_273 Brassicales #>         GROUP #> 1 TPL("Lamiaceae") #>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS    FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER    ORDER       GROUP #> 1   Lamiaceae      Lamiaceae Lamiaceae    APGIII_373 Lamiales Angiosperms TPL("Labiatae") #>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS    FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER    ORDER       GROUP #> 1    Labiatae       Labiatae Lamiaceae    APGIII_373 Lamiales Angiosperms  TPL("Asteraceae") #>   YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS Apiaceae       Apiaceae Apiaceae    APGIII_413 Apiales Angiosperms TPL("Umbelliferae") #>    YOUR_SEARCH POSSIBLE_GENUS   FAMILY FAMILY_NUMBER   ORDER       GROUP #> 1 Umbelliferae   Umbelliferae Apiaceae    APGIII_413 Apiales Angiosperms
